cyclone.name: NICOLE
cyclone.current_location: about 460 mi (740 km) east of West Palm Beach, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west toward the north-western Bahamas today, then toward the east coast of Florida Wednesday night, before bending northwest across central/northern Florida and into southern Georgia Thursday–Thursday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: east-central Florida coast near or just north of Boca Raton

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hallandale Beach to Boca Raton, FL (includes Port Everglades)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hallandale Beach FL to Boca Raton FL for Tropical-storm conditions; Hurricane warning extends north of Boca Raton to the Flagler/Volusia County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Much of Florida’s east coast from Boca Raton northward to Georgia, plus the north-western Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) expected by early Wednesday; hurricane-force gusts are possible under the Hurricane Watch.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible along the Broward County coast, especially near high tide, accompanied by large breakers.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 7 inches could lead to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; minor coastal erosion.
